name: The Royal Meeting of 1914
obverse: Busts of Christian X of Denmark, Haakon VII of Norway, and Gustaf V of Sweden each in a circle. Below the circles are the coat of arms of Norway, Sweden, and Denmark.
reverse: A view of the Residence in Malmö, Sweden. At the bottom is the coat of arms of Malmö.
description: The Royal Meeting of 1914 was held between the kings of Norway, Sweden, and Denmark in response to the start of WWI.
The three countries agreed to a policy of neutrality.
